struggle_text: My Western Blot keeps failing. I've tried everything - different antibodies, different blocking buffers, even different labs. Nothing works. I'm in my 3rd year and feel like I'm wasting time.
My PI is constantly changing the project direction. Every week it's something new. I can't make progress because the goalposts keep moving. I don't know how to have this conversation.
Everyone in my lab publishes faster than me. I see papers coming out left and right while I'm still troubleshooting basic methods. I feel like an imposter.
My committee meeting is next week and I have nothing to show. My experiments keep failing and I'm terrified of disappointing my advisor. The pressure is overwhelming.

I've been working on this project for 6 months and still don't have publishable results. My PI keeps asking when I'll have data, but every experiment reveals new problems. I'm questioning if I'm cut out for research.
Lab culture is toxic. People compete instead of collaborate. I feel isolated and don't know who to trust. I want to switch labs but I'm already 2 years in.
My reagent order got delayed again. This is the third time this month. I can't make progress without it and my timeline is slipping. I feel helpless.
I spent 3 months optimizing a protocol only to find out someone else published it last year. I feel like I wasted all that time. Should I pivot or continue?
My postdoc application got rejected again. This is the 5th one. I'm starting to think I'm not good enough. Maybe I should leave academia.
I'm the only person in my lab working on this technique. When things go wrong, I have no one to ask. I feel completely alone in troubleshooting.
My PI never gives feedback. I send drafts and get no response for weeks. Then suddenly it's urgent. I don't know how to manage expectations.
I'm balancing lab work, teaching, and my own research. There aren't enough hours in the day. I'm burning out but can't slow down.
My paper got rejected with harsh reviews. One reviewer was particularly mean. I'm questioning everything about my work now.
I can't get my code to work. I've been debugging for days. Stack Overflow doesn't help. I feel like I'm missing something fundamental.
My experiment worked perfectly in pilot but fails every time I scale up. I don't understand why. My PI is losing patience.
